metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28738 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A double free was found in the Regexp compiler in Ruby 3.x before 3.0.4 and 3.1.x before 3.1.2. If a victim attempts to create a Regexp from untrusted user input, an attacker may be able to write to unexpected memory locations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28738` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby3.0 - 3.0.2-7ubuntu2.1
ruby3.0 - 3.0.2-7ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby3.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.2-7ubuntu2.1').
